::: {.question-block}
<form onsubmit="event.preventDefault(); checkAnswer('module3_mcq_q73')" data-correct-answer="C">
<strong style="display: block;">
An investor builds a portfolio with 60% in Asset A (σ = 15%) and 40% in Asset B (σ = 25%). The correlation between A and B is 0.3. What is the portfolio’s volatility?
</strong>
<label><input type="radio" name="module3_mcq_q73" value="A"> A. 17.0%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module3_mcq_q73" value="B"> B. 17.5%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module3_mcq_q73" value="C"> C. 18.0%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module3_mcq_q73" value="D"> D. 18.5%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module3_mcq_q73" value="E"> E. 19.0%</label><br>
</form>
<div id="feedback-module3_mcq_q73" class="feedback" data-status="" style="display:none;">
✅ Correct: C. Portfolio volatility is  
\(\sigma_p = \sqrt{w_A^2\sigma_A^2 + w_B^2\sigma_B^2 + 2w_Aw_B\sigma_A\sigma_B\rho_{AB}}\).  
Substituting:  
\(\sigma_p = \sqrt{0.36(0.15^2) + 0.16(0.25^2) + 2(0.6)(0.4)(0.15)(0.25)(0.3)} \approx 18.0\%\).  
This illustrates how diversification reduces risk below the weighted average of 19%.
</div>
:::
